GameEventAction.Description:
At long last, we have developed the technology to explore beyond our planet, thanks to the excavation of the ancient Haakonish ruins on our homeworld. The ingenuity of our forebears now belongs to us!
These ruins contain records of a great betrayal and indicate that this planet was attacked from space long ago. This corroborates the oldest legends who our people, which speak of terrible creatures who came from the sky to steal our wealth, enslave our soldiers, and even devour our children.
We now know there is at least a seed of truth at the heart of these legends. And so, as we venture into the unknown, we must remain vigilant, wise, and suspicious. As the proverb tells us, "Trust is for the foolish, and wealth is for the taking."
We cannot know what we will find as we travel beyond this world, but we can dream of new worlds to plunder, vast riches to gather, and lesser beings to exploit. What we have discovered about our ancestors, and what we have accomplished ourselves, erases all doubts about the superiority of the Haakonish. Even so, we must beware of ancient enemies.
If we are true to our nature and seek to gain much while risking little, then greatness surely awaits us. We will reinvest in what makes us Haakonish and earn back the glories of our past!

For countless generations, we have looked to the stars while living among the remains of the civilization of our ancestors.
Tales from those days of a terrible cataclysm which destroyed them were passed down to us, but only recently has our science allowed us to better understand the artifacts they left behind. We now know for certain that we are not the first of our kind to leave our planet.
They went to the stars before us and left behind a path for us to follow, in the form of these ancient relics. Our long study of these ruins has helped us learn to construct starships and possibly even faster than light travel without the effects of time dilation. We have also recovered a great many unusual resources vital to these technologies from the ruins. Most of these resources do not otherwise exist on our world and must be used carefully. As our first priority, we must find more of these resources our ancestors had access to, to allow our research and exploration to continue.
We must also complete our hyperspace research to allow us to much more rapidly explore our system and beyond!
Perhaps, just perhaps, our ancestors are still out there somewhere, waiting for us, but the legends of destruction mean that we must also prepare our defenses for whatever we may find.

The great ocean of stars awaits us. Whatâ€¦ or who will we find there? In centuries past, our ancestors built the great undersea ruins that still reveal their secrets to us today. Their works were for many generations beyond us, their ultimate fate unclear, but across the ages we have long felt the call of the void. The technology of our ancestors has shown us how to travel faster than light itself, but their ruins also tell of a terrible and sudden apocalypse whose cause we do not yet understand. We must not let this deter us. Our understanding of science has allowed us to glimpse a greater destiny that waits for us beyond our world. Let us complete the work they set before us and keep science as our guide as we set forth to push back the darkness, confront the unknown - and bring peace and enlightenment to all.

We Teekans are born to wander. For generations we have traveled this world, hunting Bakdur, always seeking what is new and unfamiliar, never staying in one place for long. Yet this world is finite, and our legends tell us of a time, centuries past, when we wandered the stars, taking for ourselves whatever we could find.
These stories recount a time of great upheaval, when powerful hunters sought to destroy our ancestors. Rather than fight, they wisely chose to hide on this world. Here they survived, though at the cost of their accumulated wealth and the freedom to travel beyond the limitations of soil and gravity.
Though remnants of ancient machines have been found on this world, we could not make them work, no matter how we took them apart and put them back together again. Long have we been trapped, our very nature denied us. Even worse, here we are vulnerable should we be discovered by the ancient hunters who ravaged the galaxy long ago. True safety requires perpetual wandering.
Yet we never gave up. We continued to tinker, continued to experiment. At long last we have brought some of the old machinery back to life. Now we can explore this system beyond this world. We can wander from planet to moon to asteroid, searching for what we can use for our own purposes.
There will be new riches to uncover and make our own. We will never give up seeking the lost parts, the lost machines, the lost treasures, and someday soon we will travel beyond this system and return to the stars. New sights and new riches await us!

We are the Slayers of the Mortak, the Bravest of the Brave! The traditions of our ancestors, who came here in the age before, live strong within us. We know that they were the greatest of warriors who stood against all and were never vanquished, even by the great ancient horror that consumed the stars. We have kept the old ways and the ancient pact to rebuild and regain the greatness of the champions of old. The ancient tales speak of powerful enemies, battles greater than any we have seen and incredible dangers. The honor and glory that awaits us is beyond reckoning! We will use the star drive our ancestors left for us and send forth the Brave, the Mortalen, to reclaim the stars!

We were so few after the breaking of the world. Once, our distant memories tell us, we spanned the stars, taking what we wished and discarding the rest. Now we are here, on this world, and it is not enough.
We survive, yes, but we consume, we multiply, and so now we are many. With each cycle, there is less to consume. We find ourselves constrained, and this is not our nature.
We were never meant to be limited to one world, to one sun. It is right and good to devour, to multiply, to dominate. The time has come to use the remnants of the forgotten technology uncovered in ancient ruins. We will build star ships again and bring our young to new worlds. They will feed upon what we find, and they will grow strong. We will dominate all that we encounter.
If any dare threaten the Boskara, they will be crushed. If they defy us, the will be consumed. We will multiply until all is Boskara.

In the ruins of an ancient archive vault, we have discovered much about our past, and perhaps the path to our future.
Centuries ago, the Zenox Technocracy spanned the stars, inhabiting many worlds, revealing the secrets of the universe. Our knowledge, unmatched by any other civilization, was the source of our power.
Then came the great Cataclysm, the war with the enemy from beyond, the Shakturi. They shattered galactic civilization and nearly ended all sentient life. Our ancestors took refuge in this isolated place, cut off from other worlds and other species. Here we settled and mourned all that was destroyed. We have since struggled to regain our knowledge, our technology, and our past excellence.
In the chaos that followed the Cataclysm, technologies our forebears intended to preserve became inaccessible. We lacked the means to unlock, activate or manufacture the great innovations of our ancestors.
Finally, the dark times may be coming to an end. We have rediscovered some of the secrets of these ancient systems. This, in turn, has enabled us to gain access to one of the preserved data storage devices.
Within it we found enough pieces of the ancient sciences to allow us to travel to space. At last, we can leave this world, which for so long has both sustained us and kept us prisoner.
We are a mere shadow of our glorious ancestors. We have lost so much of what made the Zenox the most knowledgeable and important civilization in a galaxy teeming with life. Now the journey of re-discovery begins, and the secrets of the galaxy await us!

The construction of our first mining station allows us to gather large quantities of valuable resources for use in powering the economy of our home world and building more star ships.
Our freighters will soon begin travelling to this new mining station, returning it's resources to our home world. These resources may even be sold to others in the galaxy, further boosting our fledgling empire.
We should keep building more new mining stations, especially targeting key resources that both our ship-building and home world require.

Constructing a research station gives a huge boost to our research efforts, allowing us to achieve technology breakthroughs faster.
Stationing suitable scientists at {0} will improve our research even more.

We have constructed our first star ship, the {0}! This event marks the beginning of our return to the stars.
We must continue to expand and explore our solar system. Build more ships to establish a thriving solar empire.

We have constructed our first military ship, the {0}! We are now able to defend ourselves against threats.
Build more military ships to protect our empire throughout our star system.

We have constructed a spaceport. This large orbital base serves as a ship yard, allowing us to build many different types of star ships.
Our new spaceport also provides a hub for trade and commerce. Freighters will deliver cargo here and ships can refuel here.
As our technology progresses we should upgrade our spaceport with other capabilities: shields and weapons for defense, research labs, sensors and more.

With the development of {5}, we have acquired the technology necessary to colonize new worlds!
We should identify hospitable planets that are good candidates for new colonies. Then begin building colossal Colony Ships to send out to these new worlds.
At this point we have truly become a space-faring civilization. As we move out into the galaxy, we will continue to grow and gain the upper hand over pirates and mercenaries.
Now has come the age of expansion where we must compete against other empires for dominance in the galaxy...

Using the ancient knowledge recovered in our earlier exploration, we have developed our first primitive hyperdrive. This breakthrough technology allows our star ships to travel faster-than-light!
This momentous discovery means that we can quickly traverse our own solar system, exploring and expanding. Further advances should let us even travel to faraway stars, truly exploring the galaxy!
We should quickly exploit this new capability by redesigning and building new ships with these hyperdrives.

We have encountered a Gravillex space monster in the {1} system! This fearsome beast lives in the cold dark vacuum of space and attacks any passing ships.
This Gravillex bears an uncanny resemblance to monsters described in ancient legends that descended from the sky to consume all in their path.
Perhaps it would be wise to steer clear of these dangerous creatures...

We have encountered an Ardilus space monster in the {1} system!
The Ardilus seems to be an enormous silicon-based invertebrate. It's appearance is an amorphous semi-transparent blob, with trailing red tendrils.
Our observations indicate that their preferred habitat is the upper atmosphere of Gas Giant planets.
It may be wise to keep our distance from these deep space creatures until we have a better understanding of them...

We have encountered a Vordikar space monster in the {1} system!
Vordikars seem to be large silicon-based organisms that can survive in the airless vacuum of space!
They appear to feed on the metallic minerals found in asteroids, but we suspect that they are equally happy to eat any passing space ships that they are able to catch.
It would be wise to look out for any Vordikars lurking in asteroid fields...

We have encountered another alien race, the {4}! The {4} call their civilization the {3}.
We can contact the {3} from the Diplomacy screen.

It appears that we have company. Unfortunately this is not the kind of company that we want - hostile space pirates.
Where did these pirates come from? Are they a scouting party for a larger empire? Or are they a lone group?
These pirates look well-armed and are more technologically advanced than we are. Thus, given our current situation, it would be wise to appease them in any way possible, even paying them off if necessary.

We have encountered a lone star ship, the {0} in the {1} system. It does not appear to be a hostile pirate, but rather an independent space trader.
Could there be other ships like this? Might they help transport needed resources for us?

One of our ships, the {0}, has engaged its hyperdrive, allowing our empire to travel faster-than-light for the very first time!
Distances that previously took months to traverse can now be covered nearly instantly! Next stop: the stars.
The {0} is now speeding through hyperspace - who knows what it will discover!

Pirates are attempting to raid {0}! The {3} are intent on looting and pillaging.
In the past there were rumors of secret visits from star travellers. But recently these visitors from the stars have begun to appear openly. Some, like the {3}, are hostile, taking whatever they want by force. Others come in peace and trade.
Ancient legends speak of a time when our own ancestors once travelled amongst the stars. But with the 'Great Forgetting' all this knowledge was lost.
Many of our people say that now is the time for us to return to the stars. With the technology that we have acquired from some of our stellar visitors it should be possible to once again become a space-faring civilization...

GameEvent.Name: SpecialEvent_PreWarpHomeSystem_AbandonedBase_TechOrMaps
GameEvent.Title: Which Data Should We Download?
GameEvent.Description:
As our team enters the base it automatically initiates a wipe of the central computer core!

We only have time to download one piece of information: either some star system maps or important research data.

Which item should we download?

GameEventAction.Description:
We have discovered a junk yard in our home system. The yard has a large base protecting it.

A collection of ships lie scattered around the base, in various states of disrepair. In addition other junk and debris float nearby, some of which looks valuable.

The base looks to be inhabited and active, preventing us from repairing and salvaging the ships or debris...

We have discovered a junk yard in our home system. The yard has a large base protecting it.

A collection of ships lie scattered around the base, in various states of disrepair. In addition other junk and debris float nearby, some of which looks valuable.

The base looks to be inhabited and active, preventing us from repairing and salvaging the ships or debris...
We have encountered a computer datacore floating in space. It looks to be mostly intact.\n\nWe should investigate further - it may be possible to salvage something useful from the datacore.
We have encountered a computer datacore floating in space. It looks to be mostly intact.\n\nWe should investigate further - it may be possible to salvage something useful from the datacore.

We have encountered some strange debris. It looks to be biological in origin and very old.

Its appearance matches ancient descriptions of terrifying space monsters - it seems to be the carcass of one of these huge monsters.

We should investigate further, it may be possible to salvage something useful from the carcass.

We have discovered a strange magnetic anomaly that has caused seismic disturbances at all locations across our home system.\n\nAs a result mining for resources has become significantly easier. Thus for at least the next year we will enjoy a large mining bonus!

GameEvent.Name: SpecialEvent_PreWarpHomeSystem_AbandonedBase_RevealIndependentColonyOrGalacticCoordinates
GameEvent.Title: Which Data Should We Download?
GameEvent.Description:
As our team enters the base it automatically initiates a wipe of the central computer core!

We only have time to download one piece of information: either the location of a nearby independent colony or a mysterious set of galactic coordinates.

Which item should we download?

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Massive Quake Triggered at our Homeworld!
GameEventAction.Description:
As our team enters the ruins a massive quake is mysteriously triggered at our homeworld in the same system!

The quake has caused extensive damage, even damaging the quality of the planet itself.

However it has also revealed an [RESOURCE]abundant new resource at our homeworld![/RESOURCE]

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Massive Quake Triggered at our Homeworld!
GameEventAction.Description:
As our team enters the ruins a massive quake is mysteriously triggered at our homeworld in the same system!

The quake has caused extensive damage has even damaged the quality of the planet itself.

However it has also revealed intriguing geological features at our homeworld that has given us a [BONUS]permanent bonus to all of our research![/BONUS]

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Massive Quake Triggered at our Homeworld!
GameEventAction.Description:
As our team enters the ruins a massive quake is mysteriously triggered at our homeworld in the same system!

The quake has caused extensive damage has even damaged the quality of the planet itself.

However it has also changed aspects of our homeworld, actually making it more hospitable to our race. As a result our homeworld now has a [BONUS]permanent population growth bonus![/BONUS]

A highly unusual location inside a spectacular gravitic storm.
The entire system is engulfed in dangerous gravity tears that can inflict heavy damage on ships without sufficient protection.
In addition there are swarms of dangerous Gravillex nearby - they seem drawn to the extra-dimensional gravitic energy.
The extraordinary gravitic effects make this location a highly tempting research target, with enormous research bonuses here.
This appears to be the original entry point for the ancient Shakturi when they arrived in our galaxy so long ago. The dangerous gravitic effects certainly match what we know about their destructive Wormhole Drives...

We have discovered a highly unusual location inside a spectacular gravitic storm.
The epicenter of the intense gravitic effects appears to be {0} in the {1} system. The entire {1} system is engulfed in dangerous gravity tears that can inflict heavy damage on ships without sufficient protection.
In addition there are swarms of dangerous Gravillex nearby - they seem drawn to the extra-dimensional gravitic energy.
The extraordinary gravitic effects make {0} a highly tempting research target, with enormous research bonuses at the location.
Could this be the original entry point for the ancient Shakturi when they arrived in our galaxy so long ago? It would certainly match what we know about their destructive Wormhole Drives...

This location has strange localized gravitic fissures.
These gravitic energy fissures appear randomly at the location. They slowly decay over time, but the entire area persists with these dangerous ruptures. The energy from them appears to be leaking through from another dimension. They can inflict heavy damage on ships without adequate armor and ion defenses.
Further research here might reveal more information about what causes these fissures. There are large research bonuses here, so we should build a research station to unlock the mysteries behind this location.

We have discovered strange localized gravitic fissures at {0} in the {1} system.
These gravitic energy fissures appear randomly around {0}. They slowly decay over time, but the entire area persists with these dangerous ruptures. The energy from them appears to be leaking through from another dimension. They can inflict heavy damage on ships without adequate armor and ion defenses.
What causes these fissures? Further research might reveal more information. {0} has large research bonuses, so we should build a research station here to unlock the mysteries behind this location.

Research at {0} in the {1} system has revealed some interesting details about the strange gravitic fissures located there:
It seems that the leaks of extra-dimensional gravitic energy are slowly increasing over time - these fissures are not stable. They may even re-open completely.
We have also established that these anomalies are not naturally occuring - they appear to be the remnants of some artificial process.
Who made them? How? and Why?...

These gravitic energy fissures appear randomly at the location. They slowly decay over time, but the entire area persists with these dangerous ruptures. The energy from them appears to be leaking through from another dimension. They can inflict heavy damage on ships without adequate armor and ion defenses.
Further research here might reveal more information about what causes these fissures. There are large research bonuses here, so we should build a research station to unlock the mysteries behind this location.

We have also established that these anomalies are not naturally occuring - they appear to be the remnants of some artificial process.

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Partial Logs recovered from Ancient Fleet
GameEventAction.Description:
We have boarded {0} and taken control.\n\nAlthough much has been lost, we have also been able to retrieve a small portion of the logs from the central computer core.
The messages indicate that this ship was part of an ancient Mortalen fleet. This fleet was tasked with attacking a fearsome adversary known as the Shakturi. Apparently the Shakturi won the battle...
In addition, we have found a set of galactic coordinates stored in the computer core. No explanation is given about these coordinates, but they appear to have been the next destination of the fleet...
We have added a location ping for the coordinates to the galactic map.

We have lost contact with one of our ships in the {1} system.
Just prior to losing contact they sent a message saying that they had discovered a very alien looking base and were about to investigate it. Then there was a garbled transmission with the words "must obey" repeated over and over.
We should investigate this strange occurrence, but caution seems wise when approaching this location.

A strange plague has appeared at our colony {6} in the {7} system.
It is unlike any other plague we have seen before. The infected seem to be dazed and focus their efforts on speading the plague to other victims.
We strongly suspect that this plague is somehow connected to the recent disappearance of one of our ships as they investigated an abandoned alien base.
A research project has been enabled on our tech tree (Mysterious Plague). We should research more about this plague. Maybe we can find a cure.

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Plague revealed to be Shakturi Psionic Virus
GameEventAction.Description:
Our recent research breakthrough in {5} has revealed the origins of the strange plague that struck our colonies.
The plague is Shakturi Psionic Virus. This virus makes a species more vulnerable to Shakturi psychic powers.
Although not particularly deadly, it's lethality correlates with how resistant a species is to psychic attacks.
Infected victims come under a form of psychic suggestion, making them behave in ways that maximize the spread of the virus. Thus Shakturi Psionic Virus is very infectious and can spread rapidly.
Our deeper understanding now allows us to cure this dangerous virus.

The messages indicate that this fleet was part of an empire called The Freedom Alliance. This fleet was tasked with defending a nearby system against something called the Shakturi. It appears that they lost the battle...

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Partial Logs recovered from Ancient Boskara Fleet
GameEventAction.Description:
We have boarded {0} and taken control.\n\nAlthough much has been lost, we have been able to retrieve a small portion of the logs from the central computer core.
The messages indicate that this fleet was part of a fearsome empire called the Shaktur Axis. Their last intact log entry indicates that they were jumping to attack a Haakonish core world. The logs contain no indication of a battle, yet this fleet was clearly destroyed by something...

We have come across a message while salvaging a damaged computer core.
The message describes a vast attack plan involving dozens of fleets. While in hyperspace jumping towards their final attack target, the ship progressively lost contact with all of their allied fleets.
The final entry is a panicked description of a colossal wall of energy approaching the ship in hyperspace...

We have encountered a vast field of ship debris in the {1} system.

The debris appears very alien - some items are covered in strange glyphs that do not correspond to any known language, past or present.

The field contains no complete ships, only smaller debris - the ships must have been completely shattered to pieces by something, leaving no intact hulls at all.

We have come across a message while salvaging a damaged computer core from the alien debris field in the {1} system.
The message describes a vast attack plan involving dozens of fleets. While in hyperspace jumping towards their final attack target, the ship progressively lost contact with all of their allied fleets.
The final entry is a panicked description of a colossal wall of energy approaching the ship in hyperspace...

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an intercepted communication between the Zenox Technocracy and the Shaktur Axis, which reads as follows:
"In accordance with our previous agreement we provide you this update on the Alliance battle plans. Thank you for avoiding attacks against our core worlds.
We must also warn you that some of the Zenox High Council suspect our arrangement, so we must proceed cautiously."
Following this is an outline of current fleet positions and strengths for the Alliance.
A note has also been appended to this message, apparently by the Ackdarian diplomatic consul commanding the Monitoring Station. The note reads: "Top Secret, Forward urgently to the Humans, we cannot allow this dangerous situation to continue"...

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be a note of thanks from the Human High Council to the Ackdarian Technocracy, which reads as follows:
"We offer our sincere thanks for your critical support during and after the disaster at Rekallios 5. Keeping our Freedom Alliance forces united against the Shakturi offers the best hope of success.
In that regard we appreciate your offer to rebase our 2nd Fleet at your secret refuelling outpost in the Nehandra nebula. Once your 5th Fleet reaches there we will be ready to strike back hard against the Shaktur Axis."

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an intercepted internal communication in the Boskara Conciousness. It reads as follows:
"We can no longer support your reckless alliance with the Shakturi. Queen Bhalodi has become a weak-minded fool, who will bring us to our end!
Thus we will not be sending our regular shipments of Zentabia Fluid until we can get a sensible response from you."
A note has also been appended to this message, apparently by the Human diplomatic consul commanding the Monitoring Station. The note reads: "Cracks in the Shaktur Axis? A promising development. Forward to the High Council to consider how this can be exploited"

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an intercepted transmission from the Haakonish central command to a remote Haakonish research station. It reads as follows:
"Greetings, esteemed engineers! Congratulations on the success of your recent test of the device. While the test was low power, it demonstrated the effectiveness of our great plan.
We urge you to proceed with a larger test as quickly as possible. We know that we cannot rely on the faltering Freedom Alliance to stop the Shakturi, but this breakthrough will provide a fail-safe option should our understanding with the Shakturi turn sour."
A note has also been appended to this message, apparently by the Zenox diplomatic consul commanding the Monitoring Station. The note reads: "We have very little knowledge of this project. It sounds important. This should be a top target for our intelligence network"

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an intercepted secret Mortalen report about the outcome of a disastrous battle. The message reads as follows:
"The news about our massive losses in the battle at Dorashta has spread far and wide. The cost was catastrophic: we lost 4 complete attack fleets, over 70 ships in total.
However it seems that the true objective of our attack has remained secret. Despite the great cost we have managed to capture our target! This prize should allow us to unlock the secrets we seek.
We must proceed with all haste in our ultimate project."
A note has also been appended to this message, apparently by the Human diplomatic consul commanding the Monitoring Station. The note reads: "It seems we misread this situation. Something was important enough for the Mortalens to happily lose 4 fleets to obtain it. What is going on here?"

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an intercepted communication between two Teekan fleets. The message reads:
"Greetings brothers in Great Raiders clan! We are trailing behind the Evil Beetles as they smash and break the worlds. Much good salvage and treasure they leave behind! But be careful - don't get seen by the Evil Beetles, or they smash you too!
Much easier than hunting the mighty Vordikars. Come join us in the Akridar sector. Then we trade our treasures with the Ackdars and Humans. Maybe Haakos too, but they a bit snooty, so maybe not."

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
The final message appears to be a broadcast warning of a massive energy wave approaching the base at incredible speed.
The blast wave appears to emanate from somewhere in Haakonish space and is spreading outwards across the galaxy, destroying everything in its path.
The last part of the message is a brief video clip of the base commander telling everyone to seek shelter and to save the data to blast-protected storage.

Hail, Dirtsider! We are the Ghost Fleet and we have long watched over your primitive world. Our old legends tell us that many, many years ago, some our ancestors settled among you.

As a result, of all the plague-filled dirtballs in the galaxy, we've been a bit protective of yours and we've generally discouraged other of the clans from raiding your system. Now, this has cost us over time as some of the clans are fairly ultra-violent.

Anyway, the legends also said that someday you would take to the stars again and that when that day came, we would be able to re-join our dirt-based ancestors in one happy new clan. Well, seeing as this has now happened, we figure it's time for a chat.

The only thing is, we've been re-reading the legend and also talking over the cost of protecting your dirt-ball over the generations and the legend says that re-joining you will "return us to prosperity".

We figure this means you need to pay up and if you do, we'll know the prophecy was right and we'll join up with you.

Otherwise, well... I guess we all know not all stories turn out to be true. So what do you say?
You dismissed our ancient legends of unity.

Allright, a sign of good faith and gratitude from dirtsiders...

I guess the legends were true after all, which means we share some common ancestors. If all the legends are true, then we have a lot to tell you and maybe we need to also return to some of the older ways.

For now, we'll join our clans into one and share with you what our legends tell us.

Two ages ago, before the Age of Shadows, there was no separation between space clans and dirt clans. 

We were one people, united against a terrible ancient enemy, The Shak-tur, that killed our people, destroyed our ships and our worlds and tore space itself apart. This was a battle to the finish and defeating this enemy cost us most of our people, ships and worlds.

By the end of the war, the worlds were full of disease and wracked with natural disasters. Only the toughest survived and those that went back dirtstide were usually lost.

We learned to survive in space. We were part of a clan called the 8th Fleet back then and the only one that made it through the end.

Our last orders were to protect this system, to keep it safe and hidden from the enemy, to do whatever it took to survive until the final victory when the worlds and the star clans would reunite and return to prosperity and cooperation.

After two generations passed, some decided to go back dirtside and help those still alive there, but eventually they stopped communicating too. We who remained started calling ourselves the Ghost Fleet because the ghosts of our ancestors fought with us. We fought against the terrors of the void that appeared at the end of the last age, keeping them out of our system and away from our resources. We fought against and with some of the other star clans that survived.

It turned out some of the enemy survived too and we fought a long war against the "Hive" for many generations, losing many ships and much of the clan, but also meeting and sometimes trading with and fighting alongside other star clans, other fleets.

Eventually, we drove the last of the enemy away and then some of the clans turned on each other and we've been fighting them mostly for the last three generations or so.

There aren't as many clans as there used to be and it's been a while we've been watching and seeing the dirtsiders grow in number, guessing the plagues and disasters were over and someday we'd meet again.

The galaxy's a dangerous place and there's no telling what out there beyond this system, but working together we'll have a better chance at survival.

During your exploration of {1}, an sudden earthquake reveals part of an ancient buried starship.
A bit more investigation suggests that it was once a remarkably large warship of Human design that landed or crashed on this planet and was buried during previous seismic activity.
The current seismic activity is ongoing and while the aftershocks continue, exploring this wreck is extremely dangerous. Further exploration is clearly of great interest, but there are only two realistic ways to proceed.
We can attempt to stabilize the area, or wait until the seismic activity subsides on its own before exploring.
Which path will you choose - pay to attempt a stabilitization of the buried hull in order to explore more quickly or wait for the seismic aftershocks to settle down naturally before proceeding with exploration?

Quick action succeeds in stabilizing the area around the battleship and while the ongoing tremors cause some shifting and a few injuries, your team is able to fully explore the wreck and its secrets.

The ancient remains you discover throughout the ship suggest that its arrival on the surface of the planet was unplanned and sudden. The structure shows indications of battle scars as well as a crash landing, with extensive damage which was exacerbated by the centuries of seismic activity. 

Recovered fragments indicate that this was once the SRS Liberty, a Battleship of the Human Solar Republic and flagship of the 8th Fleet, with roughly 800 crew and 200 marines.

In addition to this information, your exploration teams are able to recover significant remains of advanced Hyperdrive and Sensor technologies.

Unfortunately the seismic events continued, with a major quake opening a new chasm which swallowed most of the ancient ship's remains for good.

However, this chasm also uncovered a second, smaller ship which was buried near the first. It appears that it was escorting the larger Battleship until some event caused both to crash land on this planet.

Your teams are able to recover some advanced Hyperdrive technologyy from the one remaining piece of the larger ship. An exploration of the smaller ship reveals it to be the ancient Human Destroyer SRS Intrepid. The state of the hull and the remains within suggest that it was in a battle of some kind before crashing here and that its crew perished with it.

Fortunately, much of the Destroyer's reactor remained intact and you are also able to recover valuable insights into reactor technology from this wreck.

The ruins on this ancient world extend across the planet both above and below ground and are relatively unstable.

This world clearly suffered from a bombardment and some other cataclysm in the distant past.

The above ground ruins seem more residential in nature. What little your team has explored below ground indicates those ruins are more industrial in nature. However, exploring above ground could collapse some of the below ground ruins and below ground exploration could also cause similar issues.

Given the instability, do you choose to focus your exploration above or below ground?

Amid the residential ruins of the {1} in the {0} system, your exploration team finds widespread decay and destruction, as well as many ancient remains which indicate sudden and often violent deaths.

There are indications that much of the massive seismic damage which is evident occured at the same time as many of the deaths in this ancient colony world, with indications of additional smaller seismic events continuing over time.

From the remains, you determine that this world was once named Cygnus. 

In one of the residences, your team discovers one somehow still functional artifact of the ancient age is amid some remains, well buried in the rubble. What wonders will this artifact reveal to us about the ancient times?

In the underground ruins of the {0} in the {1} system, you have discovered extensive signs of ancient industry and as well as extensive remains, mostly but not entirely human in origin.

Most of the underground facilities are completely ruined, but one data bank is still accessible and contains a great deal of information on this ancient Human colony, which it turns out was once named Cygnus.

 From the fragmented pieces of recoverable data, it becomes clear that it was considered a relatively unimportant frontier colony with a rapidly growing population of various species totaling around 500 million. Shortly after it was colonized, a great war against a terrible power known as the Shaktur Axis began, which resulted in an increasing influx of refugees from various parts of the galaxy. 

This sudden surge in population, along with the strains of what appears to have been a full mobilization of the population towards wartime goals, resulted in scarce resources and an increase in property crimes. 

An ancient interstellar law enforcement organization called the Terran Rangers appears to have been put in charge of maintaining order, but its methods out on the frontier were at times harsh and not always welcomed by the locals.

The underground ruins were largely part of the rapid wartime mobilization to build out an industrial base that could support the war effort. The most recent data entries seem to be from roughly a millennia ago and do not give any indication of how this place came to ruin.

Further extensive excavations in the {1} system have revealed a previously unknown sub-level which contains a massive vault, complete with an active ancient security system.

After further careful investigation, some of our scientists believe the only way to get inside is to use some of our most powerful plasma cutting and explosive devices.

Others think that with more time, we may be able to interface with the ancient security systems and "hack" a way past the defense measures, but how long this will take is unclear and it also risks setting them off.

Which method will you attempt?

Your exploration teams in the {1} system successfully cut and then blast an opening into the ancient vault, but it requires quite a lot of engineering and blasting due to the remarkable alloy used by the ancients to construct the vault.

It turns out the vault contained a large databank. Unfortunately, time has resulted in a gret deal of data deterioration and the blast damage likely caused further harm.

Your scientists are however able to recover some navigational information suggesting another ancient location of significant interest. We are also able to learn a great deal about the engineering of these ancient super-alloys used in the vault's construction.

After extensive study of the ancient underground vault in the {1} system, our scientists find a way to interface with the vault's systems. 

Some of the security measures are unfortunately triggered, killing one scientist, costing us some valuable equipment and resulting in additional injuries to personnel despite our precautions. 

However, over time, the vault's encryption is deciphered and we are able to successfully open the vault.

Inside we discover a larger ancient Human databank. Much of the data has deteriorated over time, but we are able to recover two important navigational coordinates, leading to significant locations of ancient Human science and settlement.

Our ability to interface with the ancient systems also leads to a major leap in our understanding of computational systems and architectures.

<zzzk> Genetic scans indicate no Shakturi encoding or interference. <zzt> Welcome, your return has been long-awaited. Please provide the designated security code to disable automated defenses and resume normal operaiton.
Welcome <zzkk> to the once again fully operational Prime Research Station. Automated defenses have been deactivated, Awaiting the arrival of new research staff to fully resume previous operations.
<ZZZKT> Disarm code invalid. Hostile Shakturi forces recognized. Defense systems engaged. <ZZzkal> You will now be destroyed.

Unfortunately, the capture of the Ancient Prime Research Station in the {0} system did cause some damage as many defense systems had to be destroyed or disabled, The surviving data and materials indiciate that the ancient Humans were working on several unique research projects in this station. Those projects are now available to you for completion.

When the Ancient Prime Research Station in the {0} system was destroyed, unfortunately most of its knowledge was lost with it. However, along with the debris which has proivded some insights into the station's components, some few fragments of unique research were recovered from the remaining debris. Through studying these fragments, we've managed to unlock research into a special technology.

The planet-spanning ruins on this world show that is was once a highly populated and advanced industrial world, focused on manufacturing of all kinds of technologies for the Ancient Human Solar Republic.

There is clear evidence of a massive sudden cataclysm which struck it, followed by many smaller events over the centuries. The ionic storms on the planet and within the system appear to be remnants of that cataclysm.

No life remains on the surface, although countless remains of ancient Humans and various wildlife are evident. The planet itself has also been nearly torn apart by past massive seismic events. In its present state, it would be very difficult for life to return and survive.

The ruins also prove to be an abundant source of several important and valuable resources. From the remains, coordinates for another location of significant interest are also discovered.

The extensive ruins on this world show that is was once a highly populated and advanced research world, focused on advancing science for the Ancient Human Solar Republic.

There is clear evidence of a massive sudden cataclysm which struck it, followed by many smaller events over the centuries. The gravitic storms on the planet and within the system appear to be remnants of that cataclysm and remain extremely dangerous.

No life remains on the surface, although countless remains of ancient Humans and various flora and fauna are evident. The planet itself has also been nearly torn apart by past massive seismic events. In its present state, it would be very difficult for life to return and survive.

The ruins also prove to be an abundant source of several important and valuable resources, including a supply of unique crystals with gravitic properties. From the remains, coordinates for another location of significant interest are also discovered.

The extensive ruins on this world show that is was once an extensively militarized and heavily defended world, perhaps on the frontier of the Ancient Human Solar Republic.

There is clear evidence of an orbital bombardment as well as a massive sudden cataclysm, followed by many smaller events over the centuries. The gravitic storms on the planet and within the system appear to be remnants of that cataclysm and remain extremely dangerous.

No life survives on the surface, although countless remains of ancient Humans and various flora and fauna are evident. The planet itself has also been nearly torn apart by past massive seismic events. In its present state, it would be very difficult for life to return and survive.
The ruins also prove to be an abundant source of several important and valuable resources and some of the damaged military facilities may be of interest,

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: A New Way or a False Path?
GameEventAction.Description:
One of our colonies, {0}, has discovered a previously buried Ancient Human underground facility. 

Initial communications indicated a functional Ancient databank, with much more information than we've been able to previously recover. 

As we assembled a larger team to lead the exploration and recovery, communications with our colony became more "unusual". We have now been delivered an ultimatum of sorts. 

Our colony tells us that they have found "a better way" and no longer wish to remain part of our empire. We are told we must let them go their own way and they have issued a Declaration of Independence, though we are apparently free to join them in this "new way" if we are willing to abandon our existing form of government. 

This is clearly a major crisis and they have made clear they are only willing to speak further at the highest levels, with our Leader, in person.

Do we risk sending our Leader to this rebellious colony, or do we refuse their demands and seek other means to enforce unity and prevent secession?

Our leader traveled to {1} to speak with our rebellious citizens and found there a society already partially transformed. 

The teachings within the ancient Databanks had advanced both the reason and intuition of our people to a remarkable degree. 

In a shocking change for the rest of our empire, after discussion and study, our Leader has declared that {1} will be allowed to follow this path, that our Leader will join them and that the rest of the Empire should follow. 

The Path of the Ancients as a Government type has now been revealed to us, will we and our new Leader choose to follow it?

Our greatest colony, {1} has declared independence and followed through on its ultimatum to us! \n\nThey are now independent of our Empire and it will require great diplomatic or military efforts to return them to us again.
You follow a false path.

Within the sanctuary on this world is a treasure trove of data from the Ancient Human Solar Republic which will take us many years to fully understand. 

We have already learned enough to understand that in the ancient times, the Solar Republic together with the Ackdarian Technocracy founded the Freedom Alliance, focused on defending against the powerful Shaktur Axis. The Shaktur Axis was in the service of the Shakturi, an extremely advanced and powerful alien race of unknown origins. They traveled the galaxy by tearing holes in space-time using their "wormhole drives".

When this sanctuary was created, the war had been going on for several years and many worlds and lives had already been lost. The hope was that the information here might survive, come what may.

Among the various important discoveries, we also located a star map which shows clearly the location of the ancient home world of the Solar Republic. 

At long last, we may find out what happened to our ancestors! The coordinates have now been added to our current star map.
We have discovered the ancient human homeworld. This was once the capital of the thriving Solar Republic, but now, like so many other worlds, it lies in ruins in the wake of the Cataclysm.

In the ruins of the human homeworld we've uncovered many fascinating remnants of a destroyed world and culture. Among these discoveries is the Constitution Crystal, a crystalline storage device containing possibly the only surviving original copy of the Constitution of the ancient Freedom Alliance. As the first charter to fully unite multiple alien species under one government, it is a significant artifact from the galaxy's distant past. The knowledge it imparts should improve the efficacy of our governance. We have also found the ruins of a pre-Cataclysm spaceport. We were able to gain access to its damaged databanks and learn much about ancient Human construction technology.

This world was once a significant research base for the ancient human Solar Republic. Very little remains intact, but in the ruins we have discovered databanks containing information on the Experimental Inertialess Thruster. This technology will enable us to build a vectoring engine, which will allow to for significantly faster course correction.

Our investigation of an abandoned research station, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be a progress report from an Ackdarian research outpost to the Human High Council and Ackdarian Technocracy, part of which reads as follows:
"Thanks to the combined efforts of our scientists, we continue to make progress in our understanding of wormholes and space tears. But a reliable method of detecting and disabling the Shakturi's wormhole drives is still some time away.
We will continue our research with all possible haste, knowing that the outcome of the war may hinge on our success..."

Our investigation of an abandoned research station, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an update on a research project forwarded to the Human High Council and Ackdarian Technocracy, which reads as follows:
"Success! Thanks to the critical information provided by Ugnari spies, we have made a major breakthrough in our understanding of wormhole drives.
We are now forwarding the wormhole detection techniques to our brave fleets, and will continue our research in this area."

Our investigation of an abandoned research station, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an internal Haakonish communication from central command to a remote research station, which reads as follows:
"Greetings to our esteemed Scientists and Engineers! The Ugnaris have smuggled the key to the wormhole drive to the "Freedom Alliance". But unknown to the Alliance, some Ugnaris have also sold this information to us.
You should redirect your research in this area to see if we can combine this knowledge with our experimental gravitic device. This would provide a much-needed back-up option to our tentative understanding with the Shakturi."

Our investigation of an abandoned research station, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be from a member of the Zenox High Council. The recipient is unknown.
"Our intelligence network's investigations into the Haakonish project have revealed that they have been in contact with the Shakturi. They are also working on a secret 'doomsday weapon' in their home system.
Due to these recent discoveries, we have decided to give the Shakturi the coordinates to the Haakonish core worlds. Redirecting the Shakturi advance to the Haakonish will buy us valuable time. The best outcome would be if the Haakonish put this weapon to use against the Shakturi..."

Our investigation of an abandoned research station, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages between ancient factions as they battled a terrible threat known as the Shakturi.
One message appears to be an internal Haakonish communication from central command to a research station, which reads as follows:
"We have detected an enormous Shakturi fleet approaching our core worlds, including a deadly Planet Destroyer!
We know that our gravitic device has never been tested at full capacity, but we may have to use this weapon much sooner than we had planned. Prepare the weapon for imminent firing..."

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages.
One message appears to have originally been part of the log of a ship captain named Karys Marteri. It reads as follows:
"The energy wave has caused much destruction. The few ships we have come in contact with since the catastrophe have been badly damaged. One other ship had been in deep hyperspace, like us, thus apparently protected from some of the destructive effects.
While our ship, Apollo's Arrow, has made it to the {1} system, our hyperdrive has now failed. She'll never jump again.
We're also running dangerously low on supplies with nowhere to refuel. Massive hyperspace storms have also appeared, making it too hazardous to travel anyway.
This planet's spaceport has been destroyed and the planet itself has suffered huge tectonic shifts and volcanic activity, devastating the population. Unfortunately there seems to be nowhere else the crew and I can go, so here we will stay."

Our investigation of an abandoned military base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages.
One message appears to be a report after a huge disaster, and reads as follows:
"We have had little success contacting other survivors. Of the five ships we have sent out, only the Solaria has returned through the hyperspace storms. They were however able to bring the last survivors from our research station in the Podenthia system.
While we hope there are other ships and survivors beyond this system, we dare not risk our last ship to search for them. There have also been rumours of strange space creatures that have appeared since the cataclysm. If these rumours are true, this would further endanger search efforts."

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages.
One message appears to be between a pirate faction and a colony of Ackdarians some years ago, part of which reads as follows:
"The quality of Osalia you have traded has been satisfactory, but the amount must be increased.
We've heard rumours that you plan to arm some of your ships. Do not think that we are too 'distracted' by the Hive to deal with this. Let us remind you that this is unacceptable and any moves towards independence will be met with force."

Our investigation of an abandoned pirate base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages.
One message appears to be from a fledgling planetary colony many centuries ago, part of which reads as follows:
"To the Second Starlane Consortium: our sincere thanks for your fleet's help in protecting our planet from those unhinged Gizurean attackers. Thank you also for your continued efforts to exterminate the savage Gravillex. In exchange we gift you some high-quality Hyutil Resin and Ordulos Shells."

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages.
One message appears to be the personal log of a Haakonish scientist who had survived a cataclysmic accident, part of which reads as follows:
"The events of the past few days have been an unmitigated catastrophe. Since we detected the Shakturi approach we started evacuating our home world and held the gravitic device in readiness. Then the untrustworthy "Alliance" fleet appeared alongside the Shakturi and we had little choice but to use the device.
I know our calculations must have been right - all previous tests ran well - but I believe it must have been the Alliance's untested technology that interfered with the expected results. Whatever the cause, the consequences have been disastrous.
My own life was spared only by incalculable chance against the enormous energy wave that resulted. Most Haakonish are probably dead or soon will be, this very escape pod notwithstanding.
Our own home world may never again be habitable. My only solace is that it seems impossible for any of the Shakturi to have survived this event."

Our investigation of an abandoned base, {0} in the {1} system, has revealed some interesting messages.
One message appears to be written by a Gizurean official, part of which reads as follows:
"Nobody knows the outcome of the last battle or where the Shakturi have gone. Queen Hikhare has dropped dead, possibly by assassination, and many members of the court are descending into madness.
No messengers have returned and there has been no contact from any Shakturi or our other allies. Spies are everywhere. Trust no one. Forward immediately any communication or information about the latest events."

Our scientists were long puzzled by a strange star that appeared to meander across our skies. Now we have discovered this "star" to be a severely damaged spaceport orbiting our homeworld. Surely it was built by our ancestors before the great Cataclysm, which is believed to have devastated the galaxy centuries ago. Long have we prided ourselves on our ability to design machines that are both efficient and beautiful. Now we have an opportunity to discover the engineering and artistic values of our ancestors.
In recent years we have recently made great technological strides of our own, but surely there is much to be learned from the knowledge of our forebears. Should we rebuild this spaceport or scrap it for resources?
While scrapping the spaceport, workers have found damaged stasis pods containing withered Ackdarian corpses. They appear to be many centuries old.

Our ancestors had a truly admirable understanding of form and function. This ancient station is a technological marvel and an aesthetic wonder.
While rebuilding the spaceport, workers have managed to retrieve interesting data from the logs. The Ackdarians who inhabited this station used an unfamiliar dating system, but we believe the entries date from centuries past, perhaps as long ago as a thousand years. At that time, the station detected massive earthquakes and tsunamis on our planet's surface. These resulted in catastrophic damage to the many undersea cities. In the aftermath, devastating plagues swept through the remaining population. This explains why we not only lost our technological skills, but also our knowledge of the past.
A small crew was left on the base, while the rest of the personnel took shuttles down to the planet to assist the population below. Eventually the remaining crew lost contact with those on the surface. As life support began to fail, the last members of the crew recorded that they were entering stasis in the hope of an eventual rescue.
Withered Ackdarian bodies have been found in damaged stasis pods on another part of the base. They are a sad reminder of all that was lost, and yet this is also a time of optimism. We are on the brink of sharing our knowledge, our aesthetics, our ways of seeing the universe. This is an important moment for Ackdarians and, though they do not know it, any aliens we might encounter.

Rebuild Ancient Spaceport Choice (Ackdarian) Delayed Research Stellar Hangar Bays

GameEventAction.Description:
The ancient station was a marvel, a remarkable creation melding form and function. Using its materials, we can now venture out among the stars, sharing our knowledge, our aesthetics, our ways of seeing the universe. This is an important moment for Ackdarians and, though they do not know it, any aliens we might encounter.
We have gained:
25,000 credits
1,000 Emeros Crystal
1,000 Argon
1,000 Mebnar

GameEventAction.Description: In the process of rebuilding, we have received a tech boost in engines

GameEvent.Name: Rebuild Ancient Spaceport Choice (Ackdarian) Delayed Research Stellar Hangar Bays

GameEventAction.MessageTitle: Secrets of Stellar Hangar Bays Deciphered
GameEventAction.Description: In the process of rebuilding, we have received a tech boost in stellar hangar bays.

We have discovered the remnants of a crashed research station on the surface of this world.
It appears it was once in orbit, but our engineers say it shows signs of a violent crash-landing rather than a gradual reentry.
The amount of debris indicates it must have been an enormous station, larger than anything we can currently build. It is possible we could learn a great deal by studying the remnants. Alternatively, we could put the recovered material to use in advancing our own technology. This way we could hope to replicate the achievements of the ancients.
Studying the research station will take some time. Our scientists will report back once they have compiled their results.

In studying the research station, we found remains of Ackdarians as well as three other species. Surviving data indicates the Ackdarians and the aliens were all part of a "Freedom Alliance," dedicated to protecting the galaxy from an invading force. We've been unable to determine what this force might have been, but it seems clear that the ancient Ackdarians believed civilization itself was at risk.
We have also recovered information about the ancient Ackdarians hyperdrive technology, which we can use to advance our own research efforts. This knowledge will make it possible for us to reclaim the stars all the more quickly, and that is surely good news for any civilizations we will someday encounter.

When salvaging the debris, we found resources that will aid in our hyperdrive research, 20k credits, and a tech boost for hyperspace. This knowledge will make it possible for us to reclaim the stars all the more quickly, and that is surely good news for any civilizations we will someday encounter.
20,000 credits
1,000 Aculon
1,000 Polymer

We have discovered the remnants of a crashed research station on the surface of this world.
It appears it was once in orbit, but our engineers say it shows signs of a violent crash-landing rather than a gradual reentry.
The amount of debris indicates it must have been an enormous station. It is possible we could learn a great deal by studying the remnants. Alternatively, we could put the recovered material to use in advancing our own technology.
Studying the research station will take some time. Our scientists will report back once they have compiled their results.

In studying the research station, we found remains of four alien species, all members of the "Freedom Alliance." Many of the surviving records indicate these species believed they were fighting for the survival of all sentient species.
We have also recovered information about the ancient Ackdarians hyperdrive technology, which we can use to advance our own research efforts.
When salvaging the debris, we found resources that will aid in our hyperdrive research, 20k credits, and a tech boost for hyperspace.
20,000 credits
1,000 Aculon
1,000 Polymer

We have discovered a ruined mining outpost on this world.
This pleasingly-designed structure appears to have been destroyed in a massive quake, part of a seismic upheaval that split the surface of the planet, creating a vast network of chasms and canyons. Within, many valuable resources have been exposed.

Our initial survey shows that when the outpost was destroyed, a vast number of volatile resources were scattered around the area.
This presents us with a choice. We can proceed cautiously and take measures to avoid triggering explosions, which would cost 20k credits.
Alternatively, we can accept the risks and immediately proceed with exploration.
There are still occasional tremors on the surface, so the more quickly we explore, the better.

Our cautious exploration allowed us to retrieve the outpost's logs. They indicate it once belonged to the Ackdarian Technocracy, a sprawling and complex culture that helped to bring knowledge to art to species across the galaxy. This station, though dedicated to mining, was built upon pleasing aesthetic principles, a delightful melding of form and function. Engineers at the Ackdarian Institute of Design have already worked up several possible replicas, which are well worth viewing for anyone who has a few hours to spare in the capital city.
We've also recovered various resources.
1,000 Emeros Crystal
1,000 Nekros Stone
1,000 Kaaisan Crystal

Unfortunately, our rapid exploration triggered some of the volatile material, causing a large explosion, damaging the impressive ancient architecture. However, we have recovered the mining engine relatively intact.
We have lost 5k for destroyed equipment, but have received a mining tech boost. This will be of great use to us as we head out among the beings of the galaxy, spreading our wisdom and knowledge.
500 Emeros Crystal
500 Nekros Stone
500 Kaaisan Crystal

We have discovered a ruined shipyard facility on the surface of {0}. It was almost certainly dedicated to building military ships, and seems to have remained active until it crashed to the surface. It is by no means entirely destroyed, however, and it stands as a testament to the skillful engineering skills of the ancient Ackdarians.
Should we attempt to restore its systems, which would cost 50k, or salvage the shipyard?

The attempted restoration of the shipyard failed, wiping any remaining data. It is tragic that this ancient knowledge, which might have given us a greater understanding of our past, has been taken from us.
However within the wreckage we found an ancient holo scroll called "Eternity and the Art of Maintenance." This will give us a greater understanding of the philosophy and beliefs of the ancient Ackdarians. Truly, a fortuitous discovery!
We've also found a source of Aculon and Hexodorium.

When salvaging the shipyard, we found a source of Aculon and Hexodorium.
We've also received a tech boost in light cruiser construction.

We have discovered a ruined shipyard facility on the surface of {0}. It was almost certainly dedicated to building military ships, and seems to have remained active until it crashed to the surface.
Should we attempt to restore its systems, which would cost 50k, or salvage the shipyard?

The attempted restoration of the shipyard failed, wiping any remaining data. However, within the wreckage we've found a holoscroll called: "Eternity and the Art of Maintenance." This will give us a greater understanding of the philosophy and beliefs of the ancient Ackdarians.
We've also found a source of Aculon and Hexodorium.

When salvaging the shipyard, we found a source of Aculon and Hexodorium.
We've also received a tech boost in light cruiser construction.

In the {1} system, we have encountered a damaged, inactive spaceport that once belonged to the Ackdarian Technocracy. There is much that we can learn about our ancestors and the galaxy they inhabited if we can gain access, but it seeks an identification code at any approach. Our research suggests two possibilities. Which of the codes should we use?
The spaceport did not recognize the code and has assumed a hostile stance toward us. It seems we have lost the opportunity to recover whatever knowledge is housed within.

The spaceport recognized the code and allowed us to board.
We want to extract data from the spaceport's logs. However, power is failing, and we only have time to obtain some of it. Which areas should we prioritize?

The logs on the spaceport tell of a devastating war between the Freedom Alliance, of which the Ackdarians were a member, and an enemy called the Shakturi. These invaders used horrific weapons, and our ancestors feared that civilization could collapse if the enemy was not defeated. The vital contributions of the Ackdarians are mentioned several times, though the nature of these contributions is not specified. Given our many abilities, it could be almost anything.
We have also learned about the languages for these species:
Ackdarian, Human, Kiadian, Zenox, and Sluken.
In addition, we have uncovered the location of an ancient Ackdarian colony. Visiting will provide us with a welcome opportunity learn about, and from, our ancestors.

We have unlocked information about the languages for these species:
Ackdarian, Human, Kiadian, Zenox, and Sluken.
We have also uncovered the location of two ancient Ackdarian colonies. Visiting will provide us with a welcome opportunity learn about, and from, our ancestors.

In the {1} system, we have encountered a damaged, inactive spaceport that once belonged to the Ackdarian Technocracy. It is demanding an identification code, which we do not have. It appears that the station will soon turn hostile.
As we anticipated, the spaceport has become hostile.

We have found an old Ackdarian colony on {0}, a planet badly damaged by weapons as well as by seismic activity.
Should we explore all areas, including regions that have been bombed and are likely toxic, or should we limit ourselves to areas we believe safe?
It will cost 100,000cr to explore all areas, but only 25,000cr if we limit ourselves to the safe areas.

There is nothing more Ackdarian than to risk danger in search of knowledge. Sadly, one of our brave scientists was lost during this mission when an ancient structure collapsed, exposing the team to a variety of toxic materials. Most were able to escape and receive medical treatment, but the sacrifice our explorer made will not be forgotten. On our homeworld, artists have already begun creating likenesses in celebration of the fallen hero.
The data we have recovered shows this world was being bombarded by the Shakturi invaders. The population and troops stationed here launched a spirited and strategically brilliant defense, but their efforts were thwarted when a plague struck the colony. Shortly after the inhabitants began to sicken, the records end abruptly. Perhaps the seismic activity was unrelated to the bombardment. There is simply no way to know.
We've discovered two technologies and a damaged shipyard, as well as the navigational coordinates to our ancient Capital System.

The data we have recovered shows this world was bombarded by Shakturi invaders. The population and troops stationed here launched a spirited and strategically brilliant defense, but their efforts were thwarted when a plague struck the colony. Shortly after the inhabitants began to sicken, the records end abruptly. Perhaps the seismic activity was unrelated to the bombardment. There is simply no way to know.
We've discovered a technology and a damaged shipyard, as well as the navigational coordinates to our ancient Capital System.

Should we explore all areas, including regions that have been bombed and are likely toxic, or should we limit ourselves to areas we believe safe?
It will cost 100,000cr to explore all areas, but only 25,000cr if we limit ourselves to the safe areas.

One of our scientists was lost during this mission when an ancient structure collapsed, exposing the team to a variety of toxic materials.
The data we have recovered shows this world was being bombarded by the Shakturi. The population and troops stationed here attempted to defend themselves, but their efforts failed when a plague struck the colony. Shortly after the inhabitants began to sicken, the records end abruptly.
We've discovered two technologies and a damaged shipyard, as well as the navigational coordinates to the ancient Ackdarian Capital System.

The data we have recovered shows this world was being bombarded by the Shakturi. The population and troops stationed here attempted to defend themselves, but their efforts failed when a plague struck the colony. Shortly after the inhabitants began to sicken, the records end abruptly.
We've discovered a technology and a damaged shipyard, as well as the navigational coordinates to the ancient Ackdarian Capital System.

We have discovered a former Ackdarian colony in the {1} system.
This world shows signs of having been a thriving colony and an important research center. There were some particularly well-designed cities, which other species ought to study. They could learn a great deal.
Unfortunately, the colony suffered enormous damage, most likely during the Shakturi war, and exploring it will be a risky undertaking.
Should we explore only the safer areas or venture further into the ruins and see what we can discover?

This world seems to have been a medical research planet for the Ackdarian Technocracy, and it is likely Shakturi forces singled out this target because of the nature of the research conducted here. In addition to more traditional, physical bombardment, we believe the Shakturi attacked this world with a wide assortment of biological weapons. The diseases introduced by the Shakturi spread swiftly, with mind-controlled and plague-ridden Ackdarians attacking fellow citizens and researchers. The logs end after a note that they'd lost contact with the Alliance fleet that had been enroute.
Surviving records indicate the biological attacks here were particularly brutal, but they were not unique. The Shakturi were spreading lab-created diseases across the galaxy. Researchers feared that even if the Shakturi were defeated, these bioweapons could imperil civilization. This, in turn, might answer a question that has puzzled our scientists. We understand a great physical Cataclysm came at the end of the Shakturi war, but that does not explain why all knowledge of that era vanished. It now seems reasonable to conclude biological weapons destroyed what was left of civilization after the Cataclysm. The terrible irony is that if this world had not been destroyed, the research being done here might have saved what remained of the civilizations of the galaxy.
We've found two technologies and a damaged medicomplex. We have also found the navigational coordinates of the ancient Ackdarian capital.
While surveying, the explorers have unexplainably turned on each other and destroyed the exploration ship after transmitting the capital system's location.

The diseases introduced by the Shakturi spread swiftly, with mind-controlled and plague-ridden Ackdarians attacking fellow citizens and researchers. We've found a technology and a damaged medicomplex.
We have also found the navigational coordinates of the ancient Ackdarian Capital system.
While surveying, some of the explorers have unexplainably turned on each other, but these have been contained and quarantined. The rest of the team seems to be free of any infection.

Should we explore only the safer areas or venture further into the ruins and see what we can discover?

The logs end after a note that they'd lost contact with the Alliance fleet that had been enroute.
We've found two technologies and a damaged medicomplex. We have also found the navigational coordinates of the ancient Ackdarian capital.
While surveying, the explorers have unexplainably turned on each other and destroyed the exploration ship after transmitting the capital system's location.

This world seems to have been a medical research planet for the Ackdarian Technocracy, and it is likely Shakturi forces singled out this target because of the nature of the research conducted here. In addition to more traditional, physical bombardment, we believe the Shakturi attacked this world with a wide assortment of biological weapons. The diseases introduced by the Shakturi spread swiftly, with mind-controlled and plague-ridden Ackdarians attacking fellow citizens and researchers. The logs end after a note that they'd lost contact with the Alliance fleet that had been enroute.
We've found a new technology and a damaged medicomplex.
We have also found the navigational coordinates of the ancient Ackdarian Capital system.
While surveying, some of the explorers have unexplainably turned on each other, but these have been contained and quarantined. The rest of the team seems to be free of any infection.

At long last, we have discovered Ackdara, our ancient homeworld. This was once a pristine ocean planet, but following the Cataclysm it became unrecognizable and uninhabitable. It was here that our ancestors first ventured forth across their oceans, seeking knowledge and perfection. It was here that our people created the most marvelous technology and brilliant architecture in the galaxy. Sadly, it was here that the history of our civilization was lost.
And yet we have survived. We have ventured into the galaxy, sharing our perspectives and offering improvement to those we encounter. Perhaps in this system we will discover more of that ancient wisdom, which we can then share for the betterment of other species.

In the ruins of our homeworld we've uncovered many treasures of the past. Notable among these is the Pearl of the Deep, an ancient Ucantium Pearl of perfect quality and extraordinary size. Our ancestors treasured it, and having it in our possession will surely lead to greater happiness.

We've discovered the Constitution Crystal, a crystalline storage device containing possibly the only surviving original copy of the Constitution of the ancient Freedom Alliance. As the first charter to fully unite multiple alien species under one government, it is a unique and priceless part of the history of the galaxy. With this in our possession, our governance can only grow wiser and more effective.

GeneratedItemEventNames.string: Ancient Capital Chain Fortress World (Non Ackdarian)

GameEventAction.Description:
This massive, beautiful spaceport is unlike anything we have been able to construct, and superior to anything we have encountered in our travels. This is surely the pinnacle of spaceport design, and something that only Ackdarian engineers could create.
Studying it will enable us to construct marvelous stations of our own, and within it we have learned the secrets of building ships we have never before imagined.

GeneratedItemEventNames.string: Ancient Capital Chain High-Tech World (Non Ackdarian)
